hints.content:
Every coin has a different value.

Coin name | Picture | Value
- | - | -
Penny | ![](https://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-images/d0799f515398b1f48cb0baa7bdc8d0c12e26c70c.png) | $1¢$
Nickel | ![](https://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-images/f6c7ae82228012be92b624995809aeabc8e95370.png) | $5¢$
Dime | ![](https://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-images/2017369b968caa0c88d046bddf2406665c8cd34d.png) | $10¢$
Quarter | ![](https://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-images/1cc5cb6f4c779c49984f5a63a58443ce0ca96ff9.png) | $25¢$

First, let's find how much money Jamir has in his pocket.

![](https://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-images/ad9ef2395f04b19f3106db5c5fdfb7e3a862e644.png)

$\underbrace{\blueE{25¢}}_{\blueE{1}{\text{ quarter}}} + \underbrace{\purpleD{10¢}}_{\purpleD{1}{\text{ dime}}} + \underbrace{\goldE{5¢} + \goldE{5¢}}_{\goldE{2}{\text{ nickels}}} 
 + \underbrace{\maroonD{1¢} + \maroonD{1¢}}_{\maroonD{2}{\text{ pennies}}}= 47¢$

Jamir has $47¢$ in his pocket.

Now, let's add the amount of money Jamir found in his toy box.

$\underbrace{47¢}_{{\text{pocket}}} +\underbrace{\goldE{5¢} + \goldE{5¢} + \goldE{5¢}}_{\goldE{3}{\text{ nickels}}} + \underbrace{\purpleD{10¢} + \purpleD{10¢}}_{\purpleD{2}{\text{ dimes}}} +  \underbrace{\maroonD{1¢} + \maroonD{1¢} + \maroonD{1¢} + \maroonD{1¢}}_{\maroonD{4}{\text{ pennies}}} = 86¢$

Jamir has $86¢$ between in his pocket and his toy box.

question.content:
Jamir has the following money in his pocket:

![](https://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-images/ad9ef2395f04b19f3106db5c5fdfb7e3a862e644.png)

Then, he found $3$ nickels, $2$ dimes, and $4$ pennies in his toy box.

**How much money does Jamir have in all?**

[[☃ radio 1]]
